DOC.criteria: For information regard BMS clinical trial participation , please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com Healthy subject determine clinically significant deviation normal medical history , physical examination , ECGs clinical laboratory determination Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 27 40 kg/m2 inclusive . BMI = weight ( kg ) / [ height ( ) ] 2 Females ( childbearing potential male , age 18 55 year , inclusive . Female subject must document proof childbearing potential Azoospermic male woman childbearing potential ( i.e . postmenopausal surgically sterile ; see section 3.3.3 definition WOCBP ) exempt contraceptive requirement . However , woman must still undergo pregnancy test described section Evidence organ dysfunction clinically significant deviation normal physical examination , vital sign , ECG clinical laboratory determination beyond consistent target population Any follow 12lead electrocardiogram ( ECG ) prior study drug administration , confirm repeat . ) PR ≥ 210 msec ii ) QRS ≥ 120 msec iii ) QT ≥ 500 msec iv ) QTcF ≥ 450 msec Positive urine screen drug abuse Positive blood screen hepatitis C antibody , hepatitis B surface antigen , HIV1 , 2 antibody Moderate anemia ( hemoglobin < 11 g/dL men < 10 g/dL woman ) aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) > 1.3x ULN alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) > 1.3x ULN Total bilirubin > 1.3x upper limit normal ( ULN ) estimate glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 90 ml/min/1.73 m2 ( calculate use CKDEPI formula ) HbA1c > 6.5 % Fasting total cholesterol > 300 mg/dl Fasting triglycerides > 400 mg/dl Systolic blood pressure > 160 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure > 95 mm Hg , confirm repeat measurement History significant drug allergy ( anaphylaxis hepatotoxicity ) .
